item.title: Look out 3 series
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

TheBeanie:

I’m sorry but talking cars with most Americans is fighting and losing a battle… No matter how much you say “its not all about power” They will still say their more powerful muscle cars are better in every single way.

I just explained about how it is the total package, suspension, brakes, nice interior, and yes, more power as well. Also, I wouldn’t consider it a muscle car at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Look out 3 series
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:9, topic:428579”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=531270.msg3883104#msg3883104 date=1326216562]

That link is broken, so I can’t see the cadillac, but Dodge has been beating this car for years with their SRT8 line of cars, like the Charger, 300 etc etc. The price is the same or cheaper, and with over twice the horsepower and torque. The 2012 Charger is going to have even more power, and an 8 speed automatic transmission. No contest.

Umm not really. Yeah it has an 8 speed and more power, but its also a lot heavier, and has worse handling. It would probably lose on a track.

According to these two ‘statistics’ websites:
http://www.leftlanenews.com/new-car-buying/dodge/charger-srt8/#specs
http://www.leftlanenews.com/new-car-buying/bmw/3-series/#specs

The charger weighs 4365 lbs, while the BMW weighs 3362 lbs, for a difference of 1003 lbs. Now I’ve always heard that for each 100lbs, you subtract 10hp (don’t know how that figures into torque), so even if you subtract 100hp from the charger:

Charger: 470 HP, 470 ft-lb
BMW: 230 HP, 200 ft-lb

So adjusted to make weight identical, it’s still 370 HP vs 230 HP, with well over 2 times the torque. It also has substantially wider tires and puts more rubber to road. The charger still wins hands down.

Also, I don’t know what kind of brakes the BMW has, but the Charger has huge Brembo brakes all the way around, it’ll stop on a dime.
[/quote]

Charge will win in a straight line, oh wait heres the dumb thinking that seeing which car can go faster in a straight line actually matters

Oh and your comparing a 46k charger vs a 34k bmw? Your always the one complaining about how much more “foreign cars” are than “american” cars

So for the same price we could get the 335i coupe with a 300hp engine and 300ft-lb of torque at 1200rpm[/quote]

A standard Charger R/T with the 5.7L V8 Hemi starts at $29,995 and it would beat the standard BMW 300 series as well, the SRT8 would certainly win against that ‘335i coupe’ as well.

I also think it would handle just as well or better than the BMW on curves as well. We aren’t talking about the old 50s, 60s, and 70s mopar’s that I love that couldn’t corner worth a shit, all of the new suspensions are designed from the ground up with modern technology and can corner like nobody’s business. My 2007 Charger SRT8 can corner so hard that the seat belts actually hurt me without so much as squealing a tire.

edit:
@Luxury, the seats are the nicest I’ve ever seen. Black leather with red stitching and grey suede center portions, very comfortable too.

Read full topic

item.title: Look out 3 series
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I guess to many Americans, power is all that matters. But if you want to sell a car in Europe, other factors are important. The difference renders most of these discussions moot.

Besides, actually comparing two cars takes ages. Standard models might appear equal, and when you compare those two the Charger is cheaper. But a standard BMW might be more luxurious than a standard Dodge.

Read full topic

According to these two ‘statistics’ websites:

The charger weighs 4365 lbs, while the BMW weighs 3362 lbs, for a difference of 1003 lbs. Now I’ve always heard that for each 100lbs, you subtract 10hp (don’t know how that figures into torque), so even if you subtract 100hp from the charger:

Charger: 470 HP, 470 ft-lb
BMW: 230 HP, 200 ft-lb

So adjusted to make weight identical, it’s still 370 HP vs 230 HP, with well over 2 times the torque. It also has substantially wider tires and puts more rubber to road. The charger still wins hands down.

Also, I don’t know what kind of brakes the BMW has, but the Charger has huge Brembo brakes all the way around, it’ll stop on a dime.[/quote]

item.title: Look out 3 series
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:6, topic:428579”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=531270.msg3882550#msg3882550 date=1326156723]
That link is broken, so I can’t see the cadillac, but Dodge has been beating this car for years with their SRT8 line of cars, like the Charger, 300 etc etc. The price is the same or cheaper, and with over twice the horsepower and torque. The 2012 Charger is going to have even more power, and an 8 speed automatic transmission. No contest.
[/quote]
Umm not really. Yeah it has an 8 speed and more power, but its also a lot heavier, and has worse handling. It would probably lose on a track.[/quote]

According to these two ‘statistics’ websites:
http://www.leftlanenews.com/new-car-buying/dodge/charger-srt8/#specs
http://www.leftlanenews.com/new-car-buying/bmw/3-series/#specs

The charger weighs 4365 lbs, while the BMW weighs 3362 lbs, for a difference of 1003 lbs. Now I’ve always heard that for each 100lbs, you subtract 10hp (don’t know how that figures into torque), so even if you subtract 100hp from the charger:

Charger: 470 HP, 470 ft-lb
BMW: 230 HP, 200 ft-lb

So adjusted to make weight identical, it’s still 370 HP vs 230 HP, with well over 2 times the torque. It also has substantially wider tires and puts more rubber to road. The charger still wins hands down.

Also, I don’t know what kind of brakes the BMW has, but the Charger has huge Brembo brakes all the way around, it’ll stop on a dime.

item.title: Look out 3 series
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Wonder if Cadillac managed to design an engine that doesnt burn oil, probably not though because the tolerances on american made vehicles are horrible. For the exterior at least the bmw is still a better looking car and for the interior I think Cadillac takes that but overall I would take the bmw 3 series long before I would consider the cadicallc. Not saying the bmw 3 series are perfect but they have some small issues that are easy to avoid and inexpensive to fix.

Read full topic
